posts.post_content:
My favorite Kirin in terms of art, and second-favorite to play with (behind Cloudhoof).  
  
Also, just because Power Rangers called the Kirin a unicorn doesn't mean that they're the same. Please try to be a bit more open-minded to these kinds of things.
posts.html:
My favorite Kirin in terms of art, and second-favorite to play with (behind Cloudhoof).

Also, just because Power Rangers called the Kirin a unicorn doesn't mean that they're the same. Please try to be a bit more open-minded to these kinds of things.

posts.post_content: Since Spirit decks (especially green ones) can be insane with summoning, this is a lifegain card worth using. The cost is a little steep, but whatever. You get a 4/4 flier out of it, too.
posts.html:

7 for a 4/4 flying body isnt terrible, in green, that is decent for a flyer

Posted By: Shiizu (7/3/2011 12:26:10 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This guy is great. My deck is very slow, so i usually take a lot of damage before i get him out. After that, he will usually give me life equal to the number of lands i control every turn because of all the high cmc creatures and spells. My opponents have trouble keeping up because im gaining 6+ life a turn. With my constant revival combo using death denied and hana kami, I can usually just sit there and swing with creatures that will die, bring them back and gain life for it, without ever losing creatures for more than two turns.
posts.html:
This guy is great. My deck is very slow, so i usually take a lot of damage before i get him out. After that, he will usually give me life equal to the number of lands i control every turn because of all the high cmc creatures and spells. My opponents have trouble keeping up because im gaining 6+ life a turn. With my constant revival combo using death denied and hana kami, I can usually just sit there and swing with creatures that will die, bring them back and gain life for it, without ever losing creatures for more than two turns.
